title: Sep Diff Eq with slope and slope field

content.question: Consider the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi> d </mi> <mi> y </mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi> d </mi> <mi> x </mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo> = </mo> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 1 </mn> <mo> − </mo> <mfrac> <mn> 2 </mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi> x </mi> <mn> 2 </mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mi> y </mi> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 1 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48F4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> , where x ≠ 0. Let y = f ( x ) be the particular solution to the differential equation with initial condition f (1) = 2. (a) Find the slope of the line tangent to the graph of f at the point <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 1 </mn> <mo> , </mo> <mn> 2 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> .

frqParts.text: Consider the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi> d </mi> <mi> y </mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi> d </mi> <mi> x </mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo> = </mo> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 1 </mn> <mo> − </mo> <mfrac> <mn> 2 </mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi> x </mi> <mn> 2 </mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mi> y </mi> <mo> − </mo> <mn> 1 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF"> MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48F4@ </annotation> </semantics> </math> , where x ≠ 0. Let y = f ( x ) be the particular solution to the differential equation with initial condition f (1) = 2. (a) Find the slope of the line tangent to the graph of f at the point <math> <mrow> <mrow> <mo> ( </mo> <mrow> <mn> 1 </mn> <mo> , </mo> <mn> 2 </mn> </mrow> <mo> ) </mo> </mrow> </mrow> </math> .
(b) On the axes provided, sketch a slope field for the given differential equation at the nine points indicated.

(c) Find the particular solution y = f(x) to the differential equation <math> <semantics> <mrow> <mfrac> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>y</mi> </mrow> <mrow> <mi>d</mi> <mi>x</mi> </mrow> </mfrac> <mo>=</mo> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mn>1</mn> <mo>−</mo> <mfrac> <mn>2</mn> <mrow> <msup> <mi>x</mi> <mn>2</mn> </msup> </mrow> </mfrac> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> <mrow> <mo>(</mo> <mrow> <mi>y</mi> <mo>−</mo> <mn>1</mn> </mrow> <mo>)</mo> </mrow> </mrow> <annotation encoding="MathType-MTEF">MathType@MTEF@5@5@@48F4@</annotation> </semantics> </math> with initial condition f(1) = 2.

topic.text: 2.2: Defining the Derivative of a Function and Using Derivative Notation

skill.text: Skill 1.D: Identify an appropriate mathematical rule or procedure based on the relationship between concepts (e.g., rate of change and accumulation) or processes (e.g., differentiation and its inverse process, anti-differentiation) to solve problems.
